title: Import email templates from file
body: The idea is to add a new button "Import Email File" to let the users upload a local EML file, it's easier to manage if you have multiple EML templates. The previous button is still here but has been renamed "Paste Raw Email".

title: Added support to specify email sending frequency
body:
Using the 'Send Emails By' option in the campaign allows for the sending of emails at set intervals, but requires some mental arithmetic. For example; 

A campaign has 1,000 emails, and I want them sent at 5 second intervals so as to not overload my mail server (or help desk). I want it to start now (say 11am). Therefore, 11h00 + (1000 * 5) = 5,000 seconds, so I'd need to set a 'Send Emails By' of 12h23.

This pull request helps by adding a new input field called 'Send Rate'. It's a drop down option underneath the 'Send Emails By' option consisting of a few common send rates:

- As fast as possible
- Every 5 seconds
- Every 30 seconds
- Every minute
- Every five minutes
- Add Custom

The 'As fast as possible' option  just clears the 'Send Emails By' calendar option, setting the form to its default state.

The final option in the dropdown is 'Add Custom', allowing you to set a custom send rate. When selecting a Send Rate the 'Send Emails By' calendar will be calculated, giving the estimated finish time.

So for our example above, selecting a start time of 11am for 1,000 targets, and selecting the Send Rate as 'Every 5 seconds' the calendar will be automatically updated to 12h23. 

Conversely, if the user selects a 'Send Emails By' option then the 'Send Rate' below it will be automatically calculated, so the user has a feel for how quickly emails will be dispatched.

Finally, as the user adds and removes target groups the calendar or send rate are updated to reflect the total number of targets. The last option edited between the calendar and the rate is the one that will stay fixed, with the other one changing to match the number of targets.

These are all front end changes and the send rate is approximate, as noted in [this discussion](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/issues/1262) (there's a burst of emails as the campaign starts). This allows us to have no backend changes for this pull request as we're only doing time calculations in Javascript and updating the 'Send Emails By'.

Here are some screenshots:

- [New Campaign Layout](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63766859-fec4d080-c8c3-11e9-8a77-fb320eea29b7.png)
- [Selecting a Rate](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63766877-084e3880-c8c4-11e9-8f23-cdb5886e87e5.png)
- [Rate Set](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63766875-07b5a200-c8c4-11e9-87a9-909e09381537.png)
- [Select Custom Rate](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63766874-07b5a200-c8c4-11e9-8410-ec5055d76dfd.png)
- [Custom Rate Set](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63766872-071d0b80-c8c4-11e9-8b1e-b1d83afc250a.png)

Other additions:

- Added a mouse over tooltip to the user/groups at the bottom to indicate how many targets are in said group. Example [here](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63765557-341bef00-c8c1-11e9-901e-b31d2514b2b4.png).

- Fixed a problem whereby selecting the 'Send Emails By' calendar in Chrome would result in a text autocomplete dropping down, making it impossible to select a date. Example of the problem 
[here](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3966613/63765316-a93af480-c8c0-11e9-9b60-75829ad0f599.png); the calendar is hidden behind the autocomplete.

This pull request is a PoC to gauge enthusiasm for this change, there are probably some bugs/inefficiencies but wanted to get a feel from maintainers before putting more work into it. I've just noticed there are also some left over debugging statements too.

title: Embed or attach files based on their file extension
body:
There have been a few discussions about embedding images in e-mails (#251, #884). As it is right now, while Content-IDs were added, the Content-Disposition header was still set to attachment for all files, and as such, e-mail clients showed them as attached files. My proposed solution makes the judgement on whether a file should be embedded or attached based on its extension - jpg, jpeg, png and gif files are embedded (and have a Content-ID set), while other file types are attached. 

It might be better on the long run to offer a checkbox to set whether a file should be attached or embedded, but I believe that 99% of the time images are only added to a message to be shown inline. With these changes, adding images to a message will work as expected, while other files can still be added as attachments.

title: Add autocomplete entry for .Now and un-escape template tags
body: The previous pull request (#1451) was not merged due to some functional issues, I started fixing these. I added two entries to the autocomplete list, and added an additional step before template execution that unescapes any text found withing the template tags. I consider this a sub-optimal solution, as it would be best to do this on the client side, when the original encoding happens, but this modification had a much lower impact (being only a few extra lines of code when the template is loaded).

title: Added feature: Descriptions
body:
This commit contains changes to allow campaigns, mail templates and
landing pages to have a description.

My primary usecase for this feature is to extract the data and include it during
report generation.

Changes affect DB migration scripts, models and static front-end
files.

title: 1485 schedule campaign complete
body:
Added functionality to schedule campaign completion. Also added the ability to set completed_date via API and New Campaign web interface. To assist users in know when the completion's are scheduled the quick stat shows the completion date when after launch date. The completion date will also be displayed in the results page when the campaign is not completed and the date is after the launch date. 

I have run multiple tests using both API and Web GUI with consistent results. Multiple tests have also been added to the tests files.

If approved I will then take a look to update documentation showing these changes.

title: Added {{.FromEmail}}
body: Added FromEmail variable as requested in ticket 439. A test with sending an e-mail template including {{.FromEmail}} worked as desired.

title: Sending Profile Spoofed Hostname
body:
During a recent assessment I was sending emails through a redirector that leveraged iptables to send the message to the service provide. After reviewing the headers, I noticed that the backend GoPhish server's hostname was in the headers along with the redirector's IP. 

```
﻿return-path: <rick@nevergonnagiveyouup.com>
delivered-to: adhyan.keymon@cowstore.org
received: from NEW-02-3.privateemail.com (new-02-3.privateemail.com [198.54.127.52]) (using TLSv1.2 with cipher ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 (256/256 bits)) (No client certificate requested) by www.tempmailaddress.com (Postfix) with ESMTPS id C5CCF2273D for <adhyan.keymon@cowstore.org>; Thu, 14 Mar 2019 21:15:10 -0400 (EDT)
received: from MTA-07-1.privateemail.com (unknown [10.20.147.17]) (using TLSv1.2 with cipher ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 (256/256 bits)) (No client certificate requested) by NEW-02.privateemail.com (Postfix) with ESMTPS id DF7B960259 for <adhyan.keymon@cowstore.org>; Fri, 15 Mar 2019 01:15:09 +0000 (UTC)
received: from MTA-07.privateemail.com (localhost [127.0.0.1]) by MTA-07.privateemail.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id C613860043 for <adhyan.keymon@cowstore.org>; Thu, 14 Mar 2019 21:15:09 -0400 (EDT)
received: from never.gonna.give.you.up.again (unknown [10.20.151.245]) by MTA-07.privateemail.com (Postfix) with ESMTPA id 8B12760034 for <adhyan.keymon@cowstore.org>; Fri, 15 Mar 2019 01:15:09 +0000 (UTC)
```

This PR adds a spoofed hostname field to the sending profile. If a spoofed hostname is provided, it will be used as originating hostname in the email headers.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5638474/54402166-659d5700-46a1-11e9-87ff-92591e402973.png)

I wasn't sure if the minified JavaScript files are created as part of the build process or not so I updated both copies.

title: Add encryption for sensitive submitted data
body:
Hi, I've added the ability to encrypt sensitive data submitted to gophish from those who have been phished.
This allows for the phisher to add public keys to gophish and then select them in the campaign creation menu.

title: Added AWS terraform template
body:
Hey all,

I created a terraform template for gophish.
This lets users instantly boot up an aws machine with gophish already installed and configured.
All they have to do is run `terraform apply` and it will then output the ip of the aws box.

cheers

title: Added Full UserAgent String and IP Address in the Campain Result Page
Table load settings
body: Hello, thank you for all the work on this extremely useful project. Hopefully this feature will be helpful to other goPhish users. When trying to load campaign results for large campaigns (over 4500 emails) there was considerable delay and performance issues in chrome. To account for that, settings were created that will only render campaign results with a certain status for large campaigns. This considerably helped our campaign results load time and will hopefully be useful to others using goPhish in a large scale environment.

title: Add deleteUser method to user.go
body:
## Related Issue
https://github.com/gophish/gophish/issues/693

## Overview
This is one of the several PRs to enable to delete a user! 👍 
In this PR, I implemented `Delete~byUserId`and `DeleteUser` methods to each models in order to delete all the related records when deleting a user.

## Next PR?
I will work on a method in a controller and front after this PR is merged!

## FYI
I personally think I need to use a [transaction](http://jinzhu.me/gorm/advanced.html#transactions) when deleting a user, but I will work on this issue in a different PR since I need to fix several other places where executing a batch deletion without a transaction.

title: Aggregate Results for All Targets
body:
There is currently no way to view all targets of multiple phishing campaigns side-by-side. I've added a new page to the web UI that displays all targets of each campaign, their status, and a link to the respective campaign that they were included in. The targets are automatically sorted by status. I added a `

` tag with `style="display:none;"` before the status message in order to artificially sort the statuses in the following order: - Submitted Data - Clicked Link - Email Opened - Email Sent - others Unfortunately, the invisible `

` tag gets included in the copy and export actions (so statuses end up looking like "0Submitted Data" when exported). Possible solution could be filtering these out before exporting, then re-inserting, or maybe just figuring out another method by which to create this sort order. I would love to hear any suggestions for improvement! Since I added a new page to the UI, the route.go file had to be modified, so this PR requires a `go build` to route properly to the new page.

title: Generating Random Subgroups
body:
If you load in a large CSV file of users to phish, but don't want to send the same email to every user, or don't want to send all of your phishing emails at the same time of day, you would have to divide the groups into separate CSVs before loading each one individually.

I've added a button to the Users & Groups page called "Create Random Subgroups" that takes a single parent group and divides it into a specified number of subgroups. The distribution of users is uniform (i.e., a group of 50 users divided into 6 groups would yield 4 groups of 8 users and 2 groups of 9 users), and the grouping is random. Number of subgroups must be greater than 1 and less than or equal to the number of users in the selected parent group.

Jordan - I know you suggested moving these features to campaign-time to prevent the user having to remove the subgroups manually at any point, but I feel as though having the groups persist is more useful than it is harmful; for example, if you want to phish the subgroups at different times / dates, or with a different email template / landing page / sending profile. This is what I am looking for in my use case, but definitely let me know if I'm missing something from your suggestion!

title: Issue #538 // Localization For Web Application
body:
Config file have an 'language' parameter, 'en-us' / 'tr-tr' is the current options and translation files are in the 'translations' directory.

This is the first step of localization, messages need to be changed with keywords (example: "There is no any campaign." => 'noCampaignWarn') it will be more effective, pluralized strings needs to be implemented etc.

title: Deleting campaign & groups fast
body:
Hi,
For campaigns, I am moving the deletion of events and results into a go-routine.
For Groups, I am moving the deletion of groupTargets into a go-routine.

And i am ignoring the errors thrown in the go-routine.

The reasoning is, I think, even if the db operation in the go-routine alone fails for some reason, the details related to that group or campaign being deleted still remains in the database. But there is no way, (either through the api or through the browser), for the end-user to retrieve that data from the database. So, its as good as calling it deleted.

Even in file systems, when we delete a file. Only the inode is deleted and the file contents remain as it is  in the file system. Even though the contents are note deleted and still remain in the file system.There is no way for the end-user to access those contents without the inode entry.

The only problem is, In the case of file systems the new files overwrite the deleted files.
But in database, they stay there forever.

I think, a chance at data inefficiency is acceptable for the boost in performance we get.
Please correct me if i am wrong

title: Groups Page - Putting Limit on Targets selected
body:
Hi,
When we go to the groups page in the admin server. The [`load`](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/static/js/app/users.js#L153) function in `users.js` makes a call to `API_Groups` which [fetches](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/controllers/api.go#L152) all the groups from DB along with all the [targets](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/models/group.go#L241) of each group

As a result, the Groups Page takes a long time to load waiting for group targets it doesn't need.Since only 4-5 Targets for each group is [displayed](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/static/js/app/users.js#L173) in the Groups Page. Rest all are omitted by adding "...".

So, I have included a GetLimitedTargets function which fetches only 15 targets for each group.
And in the [`edit`](https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/static/js/app/users.js#L69) function, I am making a call to `api.groupId.get` to get all the targets of a group for display.

title: Users&Groups Selective Processing
body:
In Users&Groups, when a huge CSV file is being uploaded (lets say it has 50,000 records ),
then according to the following line https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/static/js/app/users.js#L97 , addTarget function is being called for each of those entries.

And This line in addTarget function https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/static/js/app/users.js#L143 , draws the table again and again, after adding each entry into the table.

This slows down the performance considerably. The browser hangs and we get alerts popping up asking for confirmation to kill the script.

In DataTables, there is an option called "server side processing"
https://datatables.net/examples/data_sources/server_side.html 

In this kind of processing, the datatable always stores only one page in the FrontEnd. Anytime a new page is requested, The server is polled. And the dataTable is updated with new results.

^^ In our case, the data is available only in the FrontEnd.
So, I have created a dummy API called /api/datatables/dummy, which when polled, always returns an empty Json.
And in the FrontEnd, I enabled server side processing on the datatable, and pointed the url to the dummy API. Upon receiving back this meaningless json in the FrontEnd, the ajax.dataSrc function is triggered. 
https://datatables.net/reference/option/ajax.dataSrc
In which, I add the local json i have stored in the global variable called PostData, to the server's Json
https://github.com/svigne1/gophish/blob/groups_ui/static/js/app/users.js#L100

This way, Selective processing of Huge DataSets, is accomplished on the frontend.

Additional functions like 
https://datatables.net/reference/option/infoCallback (to render the description of the table)

and removeDuplicates() which sorts PostData whenever its updated, and removes the duplicate items have been used
https://github.com/svigne1/gophish/blob/groups_ui/static/js/app/users.js#L53

Awaiting your feedback

title: Saving,Updating & Deleting Groups
body:
Since, the current implementation doesn't delete the users within a group when the group is deleted.. The users table (targets) over time starts to collect lots of junk data.

For example, Lets say, I create a group called A, and i misspelled a user's email id in it, and i by mistake save it.
Now, when i go and edit the group A, the misspelt user is not deleted. Instead, the new user with the correct email id is created. And when the group is deleted. Both the misspelt and correctly spelt users remain in the database.

And there is no way by which i can delete the misspelt user therefore the current approach leading towards a resource leak.
To avoid this, I think it is best to delete the users within a group whenever the group is deleted.( And so the changes in DeleteGroup function in this pull request)

And if this approach is taken up.. Then, While saving the group, in insertTargetIntoGroup function, the code that checks for whether or not an user already exists in the database can be removed, which will make inserting a group very fast.

Also, the criteria that all users in a given group should be unique can be achieved by sorting the array of users in the group locally in go and omitting the call for insertTargetIntoGroup function for all the duplicate entries. Also for efficiency each call to insertTargetIntoGroup can be put in go-routines.
But the current implementation has only one db connection opened as shown in the following line https://github.com/gophish/gophish/blob/master/models/models.go#L91, which i have changed by adding a db_pool variable in the config.json file, where you can modify the maximum number of db connections you want.

And for PutGroup function, taking all existing entries in the db and running a nested for loop against the new entries from UI slows down the process to an efficiency of O(n^2). Instead, deleting all rows of the group in db and adding them all again will give a performance of O(n) 

All these changes helps saving, updating and deleting very large datasets fast.
